intro: Mouriri uncitheca, commonly known as the red-berried mouriri, is a small evergreen tree native to the humid lowland forests of South America. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are edible and often consumed by local wildlife. Its bark contains compounds that have been traditionally used in herbal medicine. Mouriri uncitheca plays an important ecological role in supporting biodiversity in its native habitat.
